page.title: 05The University Parks,Oxford
page.content: The first things we noticed were the tall trees.A lot of rare trees have been planted there and most have labels.We walked down the path and came to a pond where some ducks were nesting.The River Cherwell flows along one side of the Parks with the Rainbow (or High)Bridge going over it.People punt down the river.The most important part of the parks was the sports area where cricket has been played since 1881.University teams play County teams and you can see them free.Next to the cricket pitch there is a pavilion which looks like a large Victorian house. We talked to the Superintendent and he told us that the tennis courts were changed to a hockey pitch in winter,and that football and rugby were played at the far end of the sports area.
